problem_text:
For an irreducible complex character χ of a finite group G, the codegree of χ is
defined by cod(χ) = |G : ker χ|/χ(1). Let Cod(G) be the set of irreducible character
codegrees of G. Conjecture: If G has an element of order m, then m divides some
member of Cod(G).
The conjecture is proved when m is a prime power (G. Qian, Arch. Math., 97
(2011), 99–103); when m is square-free (I. M. Isaacs, Arch. Math., 97 (2011), 499–
501); or when G is solvable (G. Qian, Bull. London Math. Soc., 53 (2021) 820–824); or
when G is a symmetric or alternating group (E. Giannelli (J. Algebra Appl., 23, no. 9
(2024), article ID 2450144); or when G is an almost simple group (S. Y. Madanha,
Commun. Algebra, 51, no. 7 (2023), 3143–3151); or when F(G) = 1 (Z. Akhlaghi,
E. Pacifici, L. Sanus, J. Algebra, 644 (2024), 428–441).
G. Qian
